snippet: Mr. Satyarthi, a co-winner the 2014 Nobel Peace Prize, has labored over India’s numbingly huge problem of child slavery, and his organization is credited with freeing some 70,000 of them.
abstract: Kailash Satyarthi, co-winner of the 2014 Nobel Peace Prize, has labored over India’s numbingly huge problem of child slavery, and his organization is credited with freeing some 70,000 children from forced labor; Satyarthi is eighth Indian to win a Nobel, and only the second, after Mother Teresa, to win the Peace Prize.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Satyarthi, a co-winner the 2014 Nobel Peace Prize, has labored over India’s numbingly huge problem of child slavery, and his organization is credited with freeing some 70,000 of them.

headline.main: Kailash Satyarthi’s Nobel Peace Prize Caps Decades of Fighting Child Slavery in India
headline.print_headline: Nobel Caps Decades of Fighting Child Slavery in India

keywords.value: Bachpan Bachao Andolan (Save the Childhood Movement)
keywords.name: organizations
